content.question:
The work shown is the Seagram Building, designed by architects Ludwig Mies van der Rohe and Philip Johnson, and completed in New York in 1958 C.E.

Describe at least two visual characteristics of the Seagram Building.

Using specific visual evidence, explain how the Seagram Building both references and departs from earlier architectural traditions.

Using specific contextual evidence, explain why the architects chose to depart from earlier architectural traditions in their creation of this work.
